channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Curved, damaged barrier, 8th November
item.description:
I leave on Naylor Road more than 1,5 years and I notice some problems with the barrier on the pavement. This old metal, damaged barrier has sharp ends and also obstruct parking plot. The parking space can not be use as the barrier obstruct the space to open the car door and might cause the damages to the vehicle. Would be possible to remove it as it does not have any reason to be there, it does not protect anything and it is dangerous for public. Please see the pictures. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2-32, Naylor Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public toilet lesnes abbey, 8th November
item.description:
We visited lesnes a bey with my 82 year old father today after a walk in the woods. With expectation this would be suitable day out as there are public toilets next to the cafe. The toilets were locked shut at 1.30pm lunchtime with a ig padlock. No sign of employees. My dad had to use the woods to relieve himself as he is elderly and coukd not wait. The public toilets have a sign stating that they are open every day in november from 9am to 5pm. There was no explanation why the toilets were shut.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: 55 Lime Bikes, 8th November
item.description:
Impossible to live in our flat with 55 Lime Bikes squashed into the bay and overflowing on the double yellow lines, the resident only parking bay and the pay and display. Emergency vehicles get blocked and the constant alarms going off is ridiculous. Itâ€™s an environmental nightmare. Please collect at least 40 of them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Church Row, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bags of smelly clothes dumped on Ethelbert Rd, 8th November
item.description:
